2.6.22  11:30 am   Do you write out week/day schedules in advance to get going? Something like "Monday: 9-10 recording vocals, 10-12 mixing project, 13-15 fun with kick drums, 15-17 writing about bicycles", etc.

     I find it hard to balance between no schedule at all (nothing gets really done) or a very rigid one (I'm too afraid to even try it or I give it up quickly).
2.6.22  10:04 am   were you feel a great dark ages in your past?(it sounds so..)

2.6.22  8:44 am   while reading the lyrics in the questions the last few days, i noticed how vividly i had remembered your songs. as i read the words on the screen i instantly heard the melody and a whole bunch of the other stuff really easily. now i don't have perfect pitch, but when i went and checked the songs to see i was always exactly on pitch as well. this happens to me sometimes with other people's songs when i play them in my head (which i do all the time) but with yours it seems i have a much better chance. usually i can't tell at all if i'm playing a song in the wrong key in my head though, but reading your lyrics made it super vivid. it's not that i think they have to be in one key, but when i hear you singing it in my head it my memory is just especially vivid. i think i remember you saying you always do a range test for your songs. might this be part of it?

      i think a lot of other music i listen to is made before someone sings "over" it and that probably results with people singing something in a way that could have been expressed better slightly higher or lower. also interesting because i am not usually a person who digests lyrics easily. i'm terrible at remembering them, but as soon as i read them the song sprung to life

2.5.22  11:49 am   hey there's a few questions i have about this song:
SLOW DOWN ANALYSIS

"look at the time, upon the wall
the clock is tellin it all wrong
you got to slow down
you got to slow down
slow it right off the wall
you got to slow down"
stop rushing.

     "my hat     is bent
oh, i got a bent hat
maybe i'll slow down
and straighten it out"
continued from the previous verse, when things aren't as they should be, the solution is to slow down, stop rushing-- that's what will right the wrongs.

     "and then twist it all around
then put it down"
doing things badly on purpose, and then letting them go for a while before you get back to straightening them out

"and i'm bobblin down 124th street
and i think i'm bobblin to a brighter day"
optimism

"and the radio's playing a different kind of music
and the universe is starting t o shake"
different music=change= brighter day
shake=change=brighter day

"look at the time, it's 12;30
i'm going to hell, and i'm late for it"
if you can people feel good about something bad, then you're bulletproof in life.

"but i'll slow down
and talk about it"
going back home lyrically to say 'slowing down's gonna right your wrongs.'
this is your dissonant optimism at work: you're pretending you can SLOW DOWN to fix BEING LATE, but your conviction regarding this is so strong that you just might be right.

"and the world goes round and then comes back down"
could you talk about this a little?

     i'll assume this line's meant to lead musically into the instrumental verse

[instrumental verse]


"now i'm swingin about my every daily business
and i'm pondering out about how it's daily been"
alright alright

"and it's easy to feel if you're useless
but it's strange wh en you tell your friends"
yeah. it's hard to sincerely admit your flaws without veiling it behind irony

     "so i re-loaded my fax machine with some fresh clean paper
so i can slow down and have a slow time printing it out"
fax machine is sort of odd, so that's why it's here. i don't understand what the verse MEANS, but i'm liking it texturally and rhythmically.

     slowing down printing out faxes is revisiting the slowing down for being late to hell idea, i.e. it isn't something you really want to do, but it's something YOU would want to do.

"then the roof blew off again and it came back down"
parallel lyrically to the previous verse. could you talk about these two lines a little? thanks

     "and hurricaines and storms cover the landscape
and the picture frames are floating off the wall
and the hourglass is twisting a little bit sideways
and the neighbourhood is all gone"
first: beautiful vocals
second: this is the apocalyptic nature of your works REALLY standing out-- you're bulletproof in life, truly
third: the hourglass is twisting sideways, meaning time is SLOWING DOWN, which means everything will be alright?

     "look at the time, on the wall
cuz it's going very very really slowly now"

     beautiful beautiful beautiful, this entire verse, and i love how the lead in to it feels like we've been 'submerged' musically somehow. great. time is going slowly now because of the 'apocalypse?'

     "and it's the only thing that anybody ever talks about
and the scientists are always trying to figure out
and the physicists are always letting it bounce around"
i'll talk about these three lines at the end of the verse.

      including an instrumental line in this entire twelve-line verse is a great choice musically, even though i don't know anything about music. this balances out the verse. freshens it up. makes people go 'ooh. let's see what's going on.'
i'm not a musician but does it mean something that the instrumental line is the sixth line?

     like does it have anything to do with those timing things the uh TIME SIGNATURE? because like i think a waltz goes:
du DU DU
du DU DU
du DU DU
which is a regular rhythm or something
and what you've done with your verse here is go:
1
2
3,
1
2
[IRREGULARITY].


"and the novelists are typically writing stories about it
and the journalists are usually breaking news about it
and the pharmacists are frequently making drugs about it
and the charities are always raising money for it"
i think this entire verse is trying to evoke that 'diagonal' quality to it. great great great.

"and the client's name is always there
and [client's name] always cares"
beautiful end to the song. somehow you've gotten 'back home' musically not by returning to the same place but by.. . creating a new home?!?!?

2.5.22  10:47 am   Do songs amplify, clarify, or give voices to thoughts in your head,
